resources.string: Accessible design allows users of all abilities to navigate, understand, and use your UI successfully.

A well-designed app can be easily localized for language scripts that are written and read from left-to-right (LTR), such as English, and for bidirectional language scripts. 

In bidirectional scripts, text is written and read from right-to-left, but numbers and embedded words from LTR languages, such as non-localized names, are written left-to-right (LTR). Bidirectional scripts include Arabic, Hebrew, and Persian. 

Bidirectionality affects not only the layout of text and UI elements but also iconography. This section provides basic, high-level information about how to consider bidirectionality in design.
